intro: Phyllostegia remyi, commonly known as the slenderleaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers with two-lipped petals, typically in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
